ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée meshwóŋè nzsènò gẅie aa míŋ fùɔ Ndavîd, ńgwɔ́ fùɔ á Yelúzálèm.
en: The words of the Teacher,  ,# 1:1 Ec 1:12; 7:27; 12:8–10 son of David, king in Jerusalem.  # 1:1 1Kg 2:12; Pr 1:1

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a mesoŋ pú ńtéŋe zìʼi tɛʼ na mefàʼ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ,
en: What does a person gain for all his efforts

ngiemboon: Lejwoŋó nyìŋ mesoŋ e cʉa, setsɔ̌ pʉʼʉ nnɛ́,
en: A generation goes and a generation comes,
The sun rises and the sun sets;

ngiemboon: Fèfà kÿo ńdɔg ye shÿó ntsíŋ,
Memí ntsèm cwóŋ ḿpfɛte tsɛ̀ɛ máŋʉ́,
en: All the streams flow to the sea,

ngiemboon: Esɔɔn shúm ŋwɛ́ ntsèm gÿo mé kʉ́a, ngwɔ́ mé lekuʼu légɔɔn nò mǒ tà ńcʉ́me wɔ́.
Ammó gie á la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ wó, á ge láʼ gíŋ gwɔ́ wó.
en: What has been is what will be,

ngiemboon: Mé gyá mmó tà ńgɔɔn ngie:
Pege lege mmó gie á la cʉa tsɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ.
en: There is no remembrance of those who    came before;  # 1:11 Dt 9:14; Ec 2:16; 9:5

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Nzsènò, n daa fùɔ pa Ésàlayɛ, ńtsẅé tÿǒsoŋ Yelúzálèm.
en: I, the Teacher,   have been  # 1:12 Or Teacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

ngiemboon: N da záb ngie n ge lɔgɔ zsénò é tsaʼa kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ, é piŋ zíʼi nò na kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ wɔ́ɔ gie mé gÿo ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ,
en: I applied my mind to examine   and explore through wisdom all that is done under heaven.  # 1:13 1Kg 4:29–34; Ec 3:10–11; 7:25; 8:17 God has given people  # 1:13 Or given the descendants of Adam this miserable task to keep them occupied.  # 1:13 Gn 3:19; Ec 2:23,26; 3:10; 4:8

ngiemboon: N da pú ńdíe mefàʼ mie mé faʼa ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ,
en: I have seen all the things that are done under the sun and have found everything to be futile, a pursuit of the wind.  ,# 1:14 Pr 27:16; Ec 2:11,17; 4:4; 6:9
What is crooked cannot be straightened;

ngiemboon: N da sele ńgɔɔn ne twó mbùm yɔ́ɔn ngie: «N da gÿo azsénò yɔ́ɔn pú ńzyéen zyéen, tà ńcʉa ye mânyìŋ ntsèm gẅie à la néŋe Yelúzálèm tá n gÿo ńtó yɔ́ɔn.» Ayɔ́ɔn mmó gie n zsě, á pú ńgyɔ́ɔn tɛʼ, mbɔɔ yɔ̀ɔn ntí lezsénò na legwɔ́ wó.
en: I said to myself, “See, I have amassed wisdom far beyond all those who were over Jerusalem before me,   and my mind has thoroughly grasped  # 1:16 Or discerned wisdom and knowledge.”

ngiemboon: N da záb páʼ n ge zsé mmó gie zsénò áa yɛ̌, é zsé menò gʉ̀gʉ̀, é zsé menò pʉ̀a,
en: I applied my mind to know wisdom and knowledge,   madness and folly;  # 1:17 Ec 2:12; 7:25 I learned that this too is a pursuit of the wind.  # 1:17 Ec 2:11,17; 4:4,6,16; 6:9
For with much wisdom is much sorrow;
